comments.content:
today download the last version.

Do have this problem, by swfobject v2.2 Compiles

I'll confirm Chad's result. Neither "compiler-latest.zip" (Windows 7, Java 1.6.0_24 build 7)  nor "closure-compiler.appspot.com" compile "http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/swfobject/2.2/swfobject_src.js" to the result your describe.
Here is the relevant snippet from the result:
function U(a){return/[\\\"<>\.;]/.exec(a)!=o&&typeof encodeURIComponent!=i?encodeURIComponent(a):a}

You'll need to provide additional details:
- what os?
- what version of java?
- the complete command-line used
- the actual source file that can be used to reproduce the issue.

I'll let someone else jump in, but I would say that:

ie = !+"\v1"

compiling to:

ie=!1

is working as intended.

java version "1.6.0_21"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_21-b06)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 17.0-b16, mixed mode, sharing)

Windows 7 SP1 chinese , nor "closure-compiler.appspot.com" compile 

I do not know why. now, it is good. Thinks!

minify error:
Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'JSMin_UnterminatedStringException' with message 'Unterminated String: '",''

Still can not resolveÔºÅ

1) How are you running the compiler?
2) Attach the file or provide a link to the version you are using.
3) Is anyone else able to reproduce your results?

nope, 
!+"\v1"
evaluates to true in jscript (IE) and false in ecmascript (everybody else). this is probably something we should fix.
the other error sounds like you're running JSMin, and JSMin has a bug.
@Nick:  dang. vertical tab. Yeah we should fix this.
This issue was closed by revision r963.
